findings.description: Unused import: java.security.GeneralSecurityException was imported but not used after switching corruption tests to SecurityException
Good pattern: private primary constructor + @Inject secondary constructor + internal createForTesting factory. Clean separation of production and test paths without exposing internals.
Storage keys match task spec table exactly: wallet_mnemonic, wallet_btc_wif, wallet_eth_hex, app_password_hash, wc_sessions, active_chain_id
Dual exception catching (SecurityException + GeneralSecurityException) is defensive and appropriate for EncryptedSharedPreferences which may throw either depending on Android version

summary: Implementation is clean, well-structured, and follows all task requirements. One minor issue (unused import) was fixed. All storage keys match spec. Exception handling covers both runtime and checked exception paths. Hilt integration is correct with @Singleton scope.
